intro: Lobelia dortmannii, commonly known as the dwarf bluebell, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, bell-shaped blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences. Due to its habitat specificity and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
